Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.
Determines if random, planet-wide effects can happen.
All units and structures lose {sightPenalty} vision range. Units lose {rangePenalty} range in Tactical Combat, to a minimum of 4.

The largest moon in orbit around this world is in transit between the parent star and us. The star’s corona flaring and the silver beads twinkling are sights everyone should see, but some can only worry about the dark shadow the moon casts.
All units lose {rangePenalty} range on all attacks and abilities, to a minimum of {rangeMinimum}.
Every [turn/], a few sectors will be terraformed to Fungal, and Spore Cloud hazards will appear in those sectors.
"Fungal" refers to an in-game terrain type. "Spore Cloud hazard" refers to in-game obstacle.

Fungi seem to be one of those few certainties in life… or perhaps of life. Enormous clouds of fungal spores have spread all across the world and the conditions are right for them to flourish even further.
Every {turn}[turn/] {explosionNumber} poison explosions with a 2 hex radius happens in a random location, dealing {bioDamage}[damagebio/] to units in range.
Deals {damage}[damagebio/] to all units moving through or ending their turn on this hex.

[tricorium/] pickups appear in random sectors every [turn/]. During Tactical Combat, this causes displacement in a random unit every {turn}[turn/], teleporting it a random distance away from its original position.
"Cosmite" refers to the in-game resource. "displacement" refers to the in-game effect.

Cosmite is a rare and valuable commodity, and it raining down on the planet is actually good news. We must be careful when handling it, though, as the material comes with a number of strange side effects.
Due to cosmite's weird properties, a random unit will displaced every {turn}[turn/]

1 Pirate Base will appear on the map every [turn/], and during Tactical Combat, wreckages will hit 5 random units every {turn}[turn/], each with a 4[strengthphysical/] strength chance to cause [abilityred]Stagger[/abilityred].

They've hidden underground ever since we touched down, but now they’ve had enough. Pirates are setting up bases and plan to invade our territory here on the surface, while they simultaneously use their ships to maneuver all kinds of debris, causing it to crash down around us.
Every {turn}[turn/] wreckage will strike 5 random units and have a 4[strengthphysical/] strength chance to cause[abilityred]Stagger[/abilityred].
Weapon pickups appear on the strategic map. In Tactical Combat, a random unit will be hit with exploding debris for 10[damagethermal/] every {turn}[turn/].

Unidentified flying objects are something that will always keep us asking questions. Are they aliens? Are they secret government spaceships? No! This time it’s sweet, sweet loot raining down from the sky — weapons big and small bursting from caches, crates, and cargo containers.
Every {turn}[turn/] a random unit will be hit with exploding debris for 10[damagethermal/].
A cache of common weaponry, dropped from orbit.
A cache of uncommon weaponry, dropped from orbit.
A cache of rare weaponry, dropped from orbit.
Every[turn/] a few sectors will be terraformed to Volcanic. Units have all resistances reduced by [abilityred]{resistanceReduction}[/abilityred].

Supernovas are massively luminous explosions created by dying stars as they shed their outer layers. Unfortunately we find ourselves too close to the shockwave of one, and it will be devastating once it hits the planet... which will be very soon.
Remnants of a supernova are damaging this unit's molecular integrity. All resistances are reduced by[abilityred]{resistanceReduction}[/abilityred].
All resistances on all units are reduced by [abilityred]{resistanceReduction}[/abilityred].
All Strategic and Tactical operations (excluding Doomsday and Doctrines) [energy/] costs are doubled.
"Strategic and Tactical Operations" "Doomsday", "Doctrines" describe in-game concepts and actions.
Cosmic rays are disrupting our satellites, causing occasional malfunctioning and overheating. While not devastating, it does waste energy intended for use in operations.
All Strategic and Tactical operations (excluding Doomsday and Doctrines) have their [energy/] and [influence/] costs removed.
"Strategic and Tactical Operations" "Doomsday", "Doctrines" describe in-game concepts and actions.

At the peak of its solar maximum our host star’s energy output increased significantly and our satellites are able to take advantage of this. This allows us to expend less of our satellite’s energy reserves than normal when using them in operations.
[foodslot/] produce {bonusFood}. All Biological and Cyborg units gain {happinessBonus}.

The many factors that go into forming a climate have aligned so perfectly, it’s reminiscent of the theoretical “Gaia” planet. Fair temperatures, good moisture levels — everything fell into place as if it was made for biological life.
Due to very favourable weather, this unit gains {happinessBonus}.
Colonies produce {foodReduction}[supply/] less. Every {turn}[turn/] during Tactical Combat, acid rain will melt {armor}[armor/] of all units.

Pollution of many different sources has saturated the air and mists, and the result is raining down on us — literally. The acidity of the rain is stunting growth in flora and causing everything from irritation to burns in those it touches.
Every {turn}[turn/] acid rain will melt {armor}[armor/] from all units.

Colony [production/] is reduced by {productionReduction}. Every {turn}[turn/] during Tactical Combat, hot embers deal {thermalDamage}[damagethermal/] and have a {strengthChance}[strengththermal/] strength chance to apply[abilityred]Charred[/abilityred] for {turn}[turn/].

A powerful and unexpected burst of solar matter has shot from our host star and has hit this planet. It has fried many of our electronics and has superheated many tiny particles floating in the air, which char every surface they touch.
Every {turn}[turn/] hot embers deal {thermalDamage}[damagethermal/] and have a {strengthChance}[strengththermal/] strength chance to apply[abilityred]Charred[/abilityred] for {turn}[turn/].

Supercharged energy generators result in {energyIncrease} increased {energyProduction} income. Every {turn}[turn/] during Tactical Combat electrical discharges will remove {shield}[shield/] of all units.

As the star we orbit ionizes more gas and dust around this planet than usual, we’re able to make use of the additional charged particles leaking through our atmosphere. This makes it easier to conduct larger amounts of electricity through machinery and weaponry.
Every {turn}[turn/] an electrical discharge will remove {shield}[shield/] from all units.

Improved astrological research circumstances result in {researchIncrease} increased [research/] income. Every {turn}[turn/] during Tactical Combat, a wave of Psionic energy washes over the battlefield that has a {strengthChance}[srengthpsyche/] strength chance to apply [abilityred]Broken Mind[/abilityred].

Supermoons have always had superstitions tied to them, but the empowering of Psionics turned out to be true. Times like these are always a good excuse to study their mental powers closely. Or just hope they leave you alone.
Every {turn}[turn/] a wave of Psionic energy washes over the battlefield, attempting to inflict[abilityred]Broken Mind[/abilityred] with a {strengthChance}[strengthpsyche/] strength chance.
Quartzite Spawners appear around the map and Mineral units gain {armorBonus}.

Silicon-based lifeforms are rather uncommon, with quartzite being one of the few known examples. Meteors filled with the creatures raining down is raising a number of questions like: “How did they get in space?” and “Do they originate from the vacuum between planets?”.
Empowered by Crystal Meteors all Mineral units gain {armorBonus}.
Refugee camps will appear around the map every[turn/] and can be picked up to grant the nearest colony 1[population/]

We’ve received a distress call from a nearby colony ship, but as it seems that no one is able to provide assistance to them they’ve opted to use their escape pods. We should provide assistance to those who have landed here; they might even want to join our colonies.

Perihelions are generally nothing special, but this time it's a little different. Our closest approach of the star coincides with the approach of our largest neighbor: a massive gas giant. The sheer mass of the gas giant is actually affecting the gravitational pull of this planet.
Due to lower gravitational pull, this unit gains [abilityblue]Fast Movement[movewalkenhanced/][/abilityblue].
Due to lower gravitational pull, all units gain [abilityblue]Fast Movement[movewalkenhanced/][/abilityblue].
The storm travels in a line and terraforms a number of sectors into Arctic sectors every [turn/]. Flying units now have[abilityred]Slow Movement[/abilityred].
"Arctic" describes an in-game terrain type. "Flying" and "Slow Movement" describe in-game concepts.

An unexpected drop in global temperatures is whipping up several blizzards across the planet. These frighteningly powerful storms are covering everything they touch in a thick layer of ice and snow, and it does not look like it will melt away any time soon.
Flying units are slowed to [abilityred]Slow Movement[/abilityred].
Slow Movement describes an in-game concept.

Several Promethean Vaults appear around the map every [turn/], and ranged attacks have {strengthChance}[strengththermal/] strength chance to apply[abilityred]Burning[/abilityred] to non-Ethereal and non-Mineral units.
"Star Union" and "Promethean" refer to in-lore factions. "Promethean Vault", "Strength Chance", "Burning" describe in-game concepts.

A lot of information has been lost since the collapse of the Star Union, including the Promethean Vaults which are suddenly being unearthed. Whatever the reason may be, they come with a number of combustible gases and elements, some even spontaneously igniting as they reach air.
All ranged attacks have a {strengthChance}[strengththermal/] strength chance to apply[abilityred]Burning[/abilityred] to non-Ethereal and non-Mineral units for {turn}[turn/].

[influence/] income is reduced by {influenceReduction}. Every {turn}[turn/] during Tactical Combat, static charges deal 4[damagewave/] and have a {strength}[strengthwave/] strength chance to apply[abilityred]Static Charge[/abilityred] to all units for {turns}[turn/].

The planet's magnetic field is constantly present, but has a variable strength. We're seeing an increase in its strength right now, and it's wreaking havoc on our communications in addition to inducing static charges in a number of different objects.

Every {turn}[turn/] during Tactical Combat, static charges deal 4[damagewave/] and have a {strength}[strengthwave/] strength chance to apply[abilityred]Static Charge[/abilityred]to all units for {turns}[turn/].
[food/] income is doubled. All Biological and Cyborg units gain {moraleBonus}[happiness/] and regenerate 10[hp/] every turn. Plant and Bee units also deal {damageIncrease} more damage.

The rate of springtime reproduction on this planet is off the charts. All at once every piece of flora has shot their seeds or spores or pollen into the air, leaving it to be carried off by the wind. Everything is covered by giant clouds of pollen and affecting all living beings.
The pollen-filled air is empowering this unit. All of its abilities deal {damageBonus} more damage and it gains {moraleBonus}[happiness/].
All Biological and Cyborg units gain {moraleBonus}[happiness/] and regenerate 10[hp/] every turn. Plant and Bee units also deal {damageIncrease} more damage.
All Colonies gain {happinessIncrease}[happiness/] income. Non-Mindless units gain {moraleIncrease}[happiness/].

For most people it’s their first time seeing an aurora and their reaction is stunned silence. The variety of beautiful lights and patterns currently illuminating the night sky are the result of a reaction caused by the star’s solar wind interacting with the planet’s magnetosphere.

Coastal Sectors produce double [food/], [research/], and [energy/], Water Units gain [abilityblue]Fast Movement[/abilityblue] and two hexes increased range on their abilities, and more pick-ups spawn at random locations on the water.
"Coastal Sector", "Water Units", "Fast Movement", "Range" describe in-game concepts.

Unusually calm weather has resulted in an unobtrusive, mirror-like sea surface. It is as if the sea has tamed itself, allowing us to harvest its resources with much greater efficiency and pick up an increased amount of objects that have floated to the surface.
This unit has [abilityblue]Fast Movement[/abilityblue] and two hexes increased range on their abilities.
Water units have [abilityblue]Fast Movement[/abilityblue] and two hexes increased range on their abilities.

In our colonies these echo's provide 1 additional resource for every [foodslot/][productionslot/][energyslot/][researchslot/], and in Tactical Combat, this creates an Echo of a random unit every {turn}[turn/].

Due to a recently detected Void anomaly we’ve been experiencing some strange echoes of ourselves. Seeing yourself doing what you just did or repeating what you just said is quite the experience. At least it seems to be helping with our work!
Void energy is creating an Echo of a random unit every {turn}[turn/].
All units have [abilityblue]Universal Camouflage[/abilityblue] and ranged attacks have {decreasedAccuracy} decreased accuracy.
"Universal Camouflage" refers to an in-game concept.

Being able to go unseen on a hostile world sounds like a good idea, but it doesn’t help if every other living being on that world is also invisible. The glittery dust that’s been settling down for a while is doing exactly that right now.
Unit has {decreasedAccuracy} decreased accuracy on ranged attacks.
Units have {decreasedAccuracy} decreased accuracy on ranged attacks.
Generate Energy[energy/] and Generate Knowledge[research/] convert {productionConversion} of our [production/] income, instead of 25%.
"Generate Energy", " Generate Knowledge" refer to in-game concepts.

They say it’s bad luck to pass up a good deal, and we’ve just been offered one. A convoy of interstellar traders has hailed us, saying they will trade some of their energy and knowledge for any goods or repairs we’re able to offer.

Hurry production costs {buyNowDecrease}% less [energy/][br/]Cyborg and Mechanical units are being healed for {heal}[hp/] during Tactical Combat and have an additional {fumbleChance} chance to fumble their attacks and abilities.

After opening an ancient tomb of sorts, a massive cloud of nanites escaped and have quickly spread across the world to nestle themselves in any electronic equipment they could find. Short-lived as they are, they are both repairing and greatly enhancing every part of machinery.
Cyborg and Mechanical units are being healed for {healthIncrease}[hp/] every[turn/] and have an additional {fumbleChance} chance to fumble their attacks and abilities.

A few sectors have been terraformed to Mountainous. In Tactical Combat, after shocks have a {strengthChance}[damagekinetic/] strength chance to apply [abilityred]Stagger[/abilityred] to all land units and cause 10 damage to a large amount of obstacles.

Two tectonic plates collided which such violence that they pushed up part of the planet's crust and formed a new range of mountains. The event was almost instant, but the aftershocks will be felt all over the planet for a while.
Aftershocks have a {strengthChance}[damagekinetic/] strength chance to apply [abilityred]Stagger[/abilityred] to all land units and cause 10 damage to a large amount of obstacles.
